set1.truth1: The Great Wall of China is the longest man-made structure in the world.
set1.truth2: Mount Everest is the tallest mountain on Earth above sea level.
set1.lie: The Great Wall of China is visible from space.

set2.truth1: The Eiffel Tower was originally intended to be a temporary installation.
set2.truth2: The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States.
set2.lie: The Leaning Tower of Pisa was built leaning due to an error in construction.

set3.truth1: The human brain consists of about 86 billion neurons.
set3.truth2: DNA is made up of four nucleotides: adenine, cytosine, guanine, and thymine.
set3.lie: Humans have more than two hearts.

set4.truth1: Isaac Newton formulated the laws of motion and universal gravitation.
set4.truth2: Marie Curie discovered radium and polonium.

set5.truth1: The Nile River is the longest river in the world.
set5.truth2: The Amazon Rainforest is the largest tropical rainforest on Earth.
set5.lie: The Sahara Desert is the coldest desert in the world.

set6.truth1: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth.
set6.truth2: The Earth's atmosphere is composed mainly of nitrogen and oxygen.
set6.lie: The Moon is larger than the Earth.

set7.truth1: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
set7.truth2: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at sea level.
set7.lie: Gold is the most common element in the Earth's crust.

set8.truth2: The Earth orbits around the Sun.
set8.lie: Mars has a thicker atmosphere than Earth.
